div.p: RB MSS M76, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

Presuming upon your kindness I take the liberty of enclosing a leaf (or frond) from a Fern received by me this morning from a person who collects for me — hap-hazard. Two mails are leaving tonight one for Melbourne and one for New Zealand and consequently I have no time to look at it. Not having seen it before, during a 16 years residence in the South Seas, I send it on to you in case it may be something new —
I recently was visited by a young German Carl Weber who brought me letters from the German Consul in Sydney, an old friend of mine.

I sent Mr Weber on such letters to the [Rotho]
Ratu? — or Chief of Thakandrovi
Thakundrove Peninsula, Vanua Levu Island? (who was educated by me) and set him exploring the lake region of Taveuni which island reaches an altitude of 4040 feet — The lake is 2500 feet above the level of the sea. I have given him letters to my people there so that he can explore to his hearts content and live at free quarters — He is, I understand, chiefly interested in the lower forms of vegetation. I enclose a note
Letter not found. from him announcing his arrival. Perhaps you might like to know of his presence here.
